Key Arguments: The bill represents government overreach and unnecessary control over free speech.
Existing laws and democratic processes already provide sufficient protection against misinformation.
The bill could lead to censorship and stifle non-mainstream news sources.
There is skepticism about ACMA's ability to impartially determine what constitutes misinformation.
The bill could be a gateway to more draconian laws and increased government control.
Main Themes: Trust in government and regulatory bodies
Notable Quotes: This ‘misinformation and disinformation’ law feels like overkill, feels like big-government overreach.
Why can’t all opinion, all thoughts, all ideas, all ‘truths’ exist side by side and let the general public decide?
Ultimately this bill simply sounds like censorship.
This bill is insidious. We do not need it nor will we welcome it.
